EN

The provided article text focuses on executive interviews from the FMLS:25 summit rather than the headline topic. Dor Eligula of BridgeWise discusses the integration of AI in investment research, highlighting growth opportunities in Asian markets and the synergy between automation and human analysis. Additionally, Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, shares his views on the proprietary trading industry, arguing that the current model is flawed due to its fee dependency and risk management issues.

Key Points

  • The text features interviews from FMLS:25 with Dor Eligula of BridgeWise and Brendan Callan of TRADU.
  • Dor Eligula identifies "blue ocean" growth in Asian markets and discusses AI implementation in research.
  • Brendan Callan critiques the current prop trading model for being confusing for retail audiences and risk-averse.

Article
